snippet: The two candidates for the French presidency held a bruising three-hour debate just four days ahead of the election. Should voters have had a chance to see them square off earlier in the campaign?
abstract: The two candidates for the French presidency held a bruising three-hour debate just four days ahead of the election. Should voters have had a chance to see them square off earlier in the campaign?

headline.main: Great French Debate, So Why Not Have More?
